result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bervis Deun Sallis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bervis Deun Sallis in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Bervis Deun Sallis in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

On motion of the State Court ordered case DISMISSED AND READ-IN.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Bervis Deun Sallis not in court, in custody.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  All parties are advised effective February 1, 2016 this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 04, Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Pick N' Save.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision to be monitored by drug testing.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Bervis Deun Sallis in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Bervis Deun Sallis in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Justice Point discharge summary, received and filed.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for scheduling conference.  Defendant failing to appear.  On State's motion, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

SAME BAIL CONIDITONS FROM 11/11/2015.   Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.   
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Bervis Deun Sallis in court with attorney Steven Rees Wiechmann.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin. LM 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 45.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Bervis Deun Sallis in court.  Defense counsel not present in court, could not be reached.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe does not appear for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
BRANCH 37 FOR BRANCH 45.  Case in court due to JusticePoint Program violation, positive drug test.
Due to positive drug test, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Pick n Save

Defendant Bervis Deun Sallis in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Bervis Deun Sallis in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for plea/sentencing.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 45.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, Defendant Bervis Deun Sallis not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Bervis Deun Sallis not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing, however, the defendant is not ready to enter a plea today.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 23. Parties are advised that as of August 1, 2015, this case is reassigned to Br. 23, Judge Grady, room 515 of the courthouse.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Bervis Deun Sallis not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant's appearance waived.  Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense counsel requests an adjourned date. No objection from the state. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Bervis Deun Sallis not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for plea and sentencing. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Oral No Contact Order with PICK N' SAVE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision be monitored by drug testing.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Bervis Deun Sallis in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Bervis Deun Sallis in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
